intro: Epilobium dracunculoides, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows up to 1 meter tall, with erect, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly serrated edge. Epilobium dracunculoides is often found in moist soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and roadside areas.
